resources.string: Every person who works for an employer is regarded as an insured person by Social Security. As an insured person, the employee must be registered and will be allocated a Social Security Number. This is a unique number under the Social Security Fund, which will be the main means of differentiating its owner from everyone else. Registration involves completing an application form providing all types of information. As an insured person, the employee must be registered and will be allocated a Social Security Number. This is a unique number under the Social Security Fund, which will be the main means of differentiating its owner from everyone else. Registration involves completing an application form providing all types of information.
